title: 115_hr970
content: The Act titled "Improving Corporate Governance Through Diversity Act of 2017" requires certain contractors to submit data related to diversity. The "Improving Corporate Governance Through Diversity Act of 2017" mandates contractors awarded contracts of $5,000,000 or more to submit data on board and executive diversity, including racial, ethnic, and gender composition, affiliation with underrepresented groups, and existing diversity plans or strategies. The Act requires contractors with contracts over $5,000,000 to submit data on board and executive diversity, including plans to improve diversity. Quarterly reports are to be submitted to the General Services Administration, and an annual report to Congress and Offices of Minority and Women Inclusion. The Dodd-Frank Act mandates annual reporting by entities on board and executive diversity, comparing it to industry peers. Data is submitted to the Administrator and Securities Exchange Act, analyzing diversity among directors and C-level executives. The Dodd-Frank Act requires entities to report annually on board and executive diversity compared to industry peers. The Administrator of General Services will analyze the data and publicly list entities significantly lagging behind in diversity. The Administrator will also review this information every four years. The Administrator of General Services will review the implementation of diversity requirements for covered contractors with annual gross receipts over $1 billion. Definitions for "covered contractor" and "C-level executive" are provided in this section. SEC. 3. Submission of data relating to diversity by issuers. Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to require issuers to disclose data on the diversity of their board of directors and C-level executives, including racial, ethnic, and gender composition, affiliation with historically underrepresented groups, and any existing diversity plans or strategies. The Securities and Exchange Commission must update regulations to enhance board and C-level executive diversity within 90 days of this Act. This includes disclosing nominee qualities, skills, and gender in proxy statements for director elections. The nominee's skills, gender, race, ethnicity, and affiliation with underrepresented groups should be presented in a chart or matrix form.
